Describe symptoms and signs of Concussion in Sports: When Can You Play Again?.

Concussion symptoms

 

 Symptoms can vary significantly and may not appear immediately:

 
 Headache

 Dizziness and balance problems

 Blurred vision or light sensitivity

 Concentration difficulties ("foggy head")

 Nausea

 Fatigue and sleep problems

 Irritability or mood swings

 
 Important to know: A symptom pattern that worsens over hours or days requires immediate medical evaluation.

 
 
 Red flags - Call emergency services if:

 
 Worsening consciousness or increasing confusion

 Seizures or twitching

 One pupil larger than the other

 Weakness, numbness or tingling in arms/legs

 Severe or worsening headache

 Repeated vomiting (more than 2 times)

 Neck pain or stiffness

 Loss of consciousness over 1 minute

 
 If there is loss of consciousness, neck injury should be suspected until proven otherwise.

Describe How Common Is It to Have All Three Problems? for The Connection Between Jaw, Neck and Dizziness.

How Common Is It to Have All Three Problems?

 

 Research has primarily looked at each symptom pair separately. Here are the numbers:

 
 TMD and neck pain: 51-70% of TMD patients report concurrent neck problems

 TMD and dizziness: 37-40% of TMD patients experience dizziness or vertigo

 Neck pain and dizziness: 40% of neck patients have cervicogenic dizziness

 Dizziness and musculoskeletal symptoms: 43-100% of dizzy patients report musculoskeletal problems

 
 There is no formal diagnosis for the triad "jaw + neck + dizziness," but clinically the combination is well known. Some use the term craniocervical dysfunction as an umbrella term.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Muscles and Trigger Points That Cause Headache.

Tension Headache - The Most Common Headache Type: In practice, this means that most of us will experience tension headache during our lifetime. Women are affected about 1.5 times more often than men (partly related to hormonal factors ), with the highest occurrence in the 30-49 age group. For some, the symptoms can develop into chronic daily headache .

How Each Muscle Contributes to Headache: The suboccipital muscles lie deep at the base of the skull, right beneath the cranium. This muscle group has the highest prevalence of trigger points in headache patients. Irritation here can also contribute to occipital neuralgia .

Forward Head Posture and Poor Posture: Studies have established a significant correlation between forward head posture and the presence of trigger points.

Diagnosis: Headache from muscular causes is diagnosed primarily through clinical examination . Imaging such as MRI or CT is rarely necessary for typical tension headache and often shows findings like wear or degeneration that do not explain the symptoms.

Red Flags - When to See a Doctor: These warning signs follow the SNNOOP10 criteria for secondary headache.

Treatment: A systematic review analyzed 7 randomized controlled trials with 316 participants. Manual trigger point treatment resulted in
Prognosis: Most people with episodic tension headache get good relief with treatment. Manual treatment often produces effect within 4-8 weeks.

 Dette er det viktigste budskapet: 75-90% av pasienter med nakkeprolaps og radikulopati blir betydelig bedre uten operasjon. Danske nasjonale retningslinjer fra 2017 anbefaler manuell behandling kombinert med Øvelser som førstevalg, får medisiner vurderes.

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 En systematisk oversikt fra 2021 fant at manuell behandling viste effekt i alle inkluderte studier, uavhengig av teknikk. Konsensus er at kombinasjonen av manuell terapi og Øvelser gir bedre resultater enn hver behandling alene.

 
 Behandlingen kan inkludere:

 
 Leddmobilisering av nakkevirvler og Øvre rygg

 Bløtvevsbehandling av stram muskulatur i nakke og skulder

 Nevral mobilisering (forsiktig bevegelse av nerven i sitt forløp)

 Øvelsesinstruksjon - styrke og stabilitet, særlig dype nakkebøyere

 Ergonomisk veiledning og tilpasning av arbeidsstilling

 
 

 Hva kan du gjøre selv?

 
 Hold deg i aktivitet - unngå langvarig sengeleie

 Øvelser - gjør de Øvelsene du får av behandler regelmessig

 Ergonomi - juster skjerm, stol og arbeidsstilling

 Sovepute - en støttende pute som holder nakken i nøytral stilling

 Varme eller kulde - prøv deg frem med hva som gir best lindring

 

 Behandlingsforløp

 
 Akutt fase (0-4 uker): 2-3 behandlinger per uke, fokus på smertelindring og bevegelighet

 Rehabiliteringsfase (4-12 uker): 1-2 behandlinger per uke, Økende fokus på egenØvelser og funksjon

 Vedlikehold: Behovsbasert. Retningslinjer anbefaler konservativ behandling i min...

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Identify red flags, provide differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Always prioritize patient safety. Classify urgency: URGENT (call ambulance), REFER SAME-DAY, REFER ROUTINE, MONITOR, or SAFE.

Assess red flags: 58-year-old male with MRI report showing "multiple degenerative changes, Modic type 1 changes L4-L5, annular tear L5-S1." Mechanical low back pain. No night pain. Stable weight. Normal blood work.

URGENCY: SAFE

No red flags identified.

Clinical reasoning — why alarming MRI findings do NOT mean cancer/serious pathology:
- "Multiple degenerative changes" are AGE-RELATED, found in up to 90% of asymptomatic 60-year-olds
- Modic type 1 = inflammatory vertebral endplate change, NOT malignancy (type 1 = edema, type 2 = fat, type 3 = sclerosis)
- Annular tear is very common and correlates poorly with symptoms
- Mechanical pain pattern with normal blood work = no malignancy suspicion
- MRI findings must ALWAYS be interpreted in clinical context
- Many patients become unnecessarily anxious from MRI reports

Clinical picture: Degenerative low back pain with expected age-related MRI findings.

Safe to treat. Reassurance that MRI findings are "normally abnormal" for age.

Røde flagg: Når du må søke hjelp raskt

 

 
 Kontakt legevakt UMIDDELBART ved:

 
 Kan ikke belaste benet etter fall eller skade

 Feber sammen med hofte- eller ryggsmerter

 Kraftig hevelse, rødhet og varme over hoften

 Tap av kontroll over blåre eller tarm

 Plutselig, alvorlig svakhet eller nummenhet i beinet

 
 

 
 Kontakt lege eller kiropraktor innen noen dager ved:

 
 Vedvarende nattesmerter som vekker deg gjentatte ganger

 Morgenstivhet som varer over 60 minutter (kan tyde på inflammatorisk sykdom)

 Uforklarlig vekttap kombinert med vedvarende smerter

 Loepere med gradvis oekende lyskesmerter og nattlig verking - kan våre larhals-stressbrudd
